abstract: Minneapolis Police Chief Janee Harteau announces Officers Mark Ringgenberg and Dustin Schwarze will not be disciplined for fatal shooting of black man Jamar Clark, touching off weeks of protests; says officers, both of whom are white, followed proper procedure and were warranted in using deadly force.

keywords.value: Ringgenberg, Mark A (Minneapolis, Minn, Police Officer )
keywords.name: persons

lead_paragraph: The police chief said an internal investigation found that two officers were warranted in using deadly force against Jamar Clark, 24, nearly a year ago.
snippet: The police chief said an internal investigation found that two officers were warranted in using deadly force against Jamar Clark, 24, nearly a year ago....

headline.main: Minneapolis Police Officers Will Not Be Disciplined for Fatal Shooting
headline.print_headline: Two Officers in Minnesota Are Cleared in Shooting
